result.execSummary:
The defendant William G Ausen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent including an AODA assessment if deemed necessary.
-------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
-------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before 11/29/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release  privileges.
*Jail time may be served in Racine County. ------------------------- **11/28/2016 AMENDMENT:  Per request of Defendant's Attorney, Judge Drettwan is granting the defendant's request for an extension  of the date by which he must turn himself in to begin serving his 60 days of conditional release time.  His NEW turn in date is on or before January 28, 2017 at 8:00 am. ------------------------- 
**01/25/2017 2nd AMENDMENT:  Per request of Defendant's Attorney, Judge Drettwan is granting the defendant's request for an extension of the date by which he must turn himself in to begin serving his 60 days of conditional release time.  His NEW turn in date is:  February 27, 2017 at 8:00 am.
------------------------
*AMENDMENT 03/16/2017 - Mr.Ausen is allowed work release to assist Mr. Mark Larson with transportation to his doctor's appointments and other needs such as the grocery store.  Mr. Ausen will have to provide the huber dorm with verification of the medical treatments from Mark Larson's treating sources as well as a letter stating that Mark Larson does not have alternate transportation to attend his treatments.  
------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William G Ausen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: E-mail from ADA Johnson, re:  not opposed to Huber release proposal of Atty Dickinson
E-mail between Court & Attys denying deft's request to be put  on EMP through DOC office instead of through Huber

2:40 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant William G Ausen in court with Atty James M. Dickinson.    
Matter is before the Court for a plea and sentencing.  
Atty Dickinson puts the terms of the partial joint agreement on the record.  The only matter before the Court for argument is conditional jail time.  
Plea questionnaire filed by Atty Dickinson.  
2:42 pm  Court conducts plea colloquy with Mr. Ausen.  
Deft enters GUILTY plea to Count #1
Court gives defendant warnings with regard to deportation, firearms restriction and ineligibility to vote.
Court finds defendant is freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea and choosing to waive his constitutional rights.  Court adjudges deft guilty
Court has reviewed Atty Dickinson's sentencing memorandum as well of the letters of support.  

2:47 pm  Mark R. Larsen makes statement on behalf of Mr. Ausen.  
2:48 pm  Seth M. Johnson makes statement on behalf of Mr. Ausen.  

2:50 pm  Argument by Atty Leusink as to sentence.  
2:53 pm  Argument by Atty Dickinson as to sentence.  
2:55 pm  Statement by deft.  
2:58 pm  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the deft.  

SENTENCE:  
Total length of sentence:  4 years prison
2 years IC followed by 2 years ES 
IMPOSED AND STAYED 
Two (2) years probation

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
1)  Sixty (60) days in Jail with work release to commence on or before November 29, 2016.  Conditional jail time may be served in Racine County.  
2)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
3)  Counseling as recommended by Agent including an AODA assessment if deemed necessary.  
4)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

3:06 pm  Court in recess.

2:30 pm FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Case called.  Appearances given.  Attorney James Michael Dickinson appeared.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dickinson advises that his client had medical appointments today and was not able to be here.  He is requesting this be put over to a new date for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court notes that the State sent a letter requesting a reset of the Jury Trial due to unavailability of a witness.  Jury Trial scheduled for Monday, September 12th is canceled at this time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant William G Ausen in court with attorney James Michael Dickinson.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Motions due prior to status on April 13, 2016

Defendant William G Ausen in court with attorney James Michael Dickinson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court for prelminary hearing, but defendant wishes to waive his prelminary hearing. Court goes over wavier form with the defendant. Information filed - reading waived. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant William G Ausen in court with attorney James M. Dickinson.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Preliminary Hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
